Description: Rock crystal bottle; small and cylindrical in form, engraved around the centre of the body with an Arabic inscription; set in a later European nielloed silver mount.
Curator's comments: Cited as one of several parallels known for a bottle attributed a 9th-10th century date in Corning (1955.1.119; cf. cf. David Whitehouse, 2010: 'Catalogue of the Islamic Glass in Corning, Volume 1', Corning, p.220, cat.368).
Bibliographic references: Lamm 1929-1930 / Mittelalterliche Gläser und Steinschnittarbeiten aus dem Nahen Osten (pl.68.14)
Shalem 1996 / Islam Christianized: Islamic Portable Objects in the Medieval Church Treasuries of the Latin West (10)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
